abstract: The Fancast service from Comcast is a potentially promising attempt to provide a single place to find Internet, television and offline video content.
snippet: The Fancast service from Comcast is a potentially promising attempt to provide a single place to find Internet, television and offline video content.
lead_paragraph: As more and more video is available on the Internet, one question moves sharply into focus: What will happen to cable and satellite television providers? Do we really need specialized networks for our TV, or will the Internet be enough once someone figures out an easy way to get Internet video onto our TV screens?

headline.main: Comcast Tries to Break Some Windows
